frameDefinitions: This frame is about the static comparison of an Profiled_item to a Standard_item, often  with respect to some Attribute.
A Figure is located in contact with a Ground.
A Device or machine is in (or out of) service.
A Device or machine is put in (or out of) service either by a volitional Agent or by a Cause event or force acting on the Device.
Item-1 and Item-2 are compatible with each other if they can exist or function together in some context without problems, conflict, or other undesirable situation.
A System interacts with the environment (which may include a volitional agent) and goes into operation in accordance with its intended purpose.
frameExamples: The Sun is putting on a show that <t>rivals</t> the most sizzling Hollywood thrillers.
There was a tight-fitting lid <t>on</t> the bottle .
The laborer realized that he <t>activated</t> the machine but did not know how to stop it.
Make sure your site is <t>compatible</t> with any browser.
The alarm <t>went off</t> as she walked through the entrance.
listRoleDefinitions: In active sentences, the <fen>Profiled_item</fen> is the grammatically more prominent one of the items that are compared and realized as  the subject. .
In active setnnces, the <fen>Standard_item</fen> is  the grammatically less prominent element, i.e. the object or an oblique.
This Frame Elements marks constituents that indicate in which respect Item-1 and Item-2 are equal to each other.
The <fen>Standard_attribute</fen> is used when the standard is a specific value on  a scale.
The <fen>Profiled_attribute</fen> is a particular value on a scale which is being compared to a <fen>Standard_item</fen> or <fen>Profiled_attribute</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Profiled_item</fen> rivals the <fen>Standard_item</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Profiled_item</fen> rivals the <fen>Standard_item</fen>.
The <fen>Ground</fen> serves as a basis for describing the location of the <fen>Figure</fen>.
The <fen>Figure</fen> is perceived as located relative to a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location. The figure can be an entity or an event.
The <fen>Figures</fen> are items which mutually serve to identify the location of each other.
The period of time during which the locative relation between <fen>Figure</fen> and <fen>Ground</fen> obtains.
The <fen>Device</fen> or machine that is in or out of operation.
The <fen>Time</fen> when a <fen>Device</fen> is in or out of operation.
The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Device</fen> is or is not operating.
The <fen>Device</fen> or machine that is in or out of operation.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who changes the operational state of the <fen>Device</fen>.
<fen>Cause</fen> identifies the non-agentive force that causes the <fen>Device</fen> to begin to operate.
The <fen>Time</fen> when a <fen>Device</fen> is put into or out of operation.
The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Device</fen> is put into or out of operation.
The Frame Element <fen>Item_1</fen> marks the grammatically more prominent of the two entities, i.e.the subject in active clauses, when they are expressed separately.
The Frame Element <fen>Item_2</fen> marks the grammatically less prominent of the <fen>Items</fen> when they are expressed separately.
This role is used when the <fen>Items</fen> are expressed jointly in a phrase, either a plural or a coordinated NP.
This Frame Element is used for expressions that indicate a <fen>Parameter</fen> or respect in which the <fen>Items</fen> are said to be compatible, not in conflict.
The <fen>System</fen> interacts with the environment and activates.
The time when the <fen>System</fen> triggers.
Where the <fen>System</fen> goes off.
listRoleExamples: <fex>This PC</fex> stacks up well against its competitors
This PC stacks up well <fex>against its competitors</fex>
The Tri-Cities stack up well against the competition <fex>in the area of innovation</fex>
We equalled <fex>father's skills</fex> .
American caviar <fex>now</fex> rivals Russia's in quality.
<fex>In Africa</fex>, the level of drug resistance rivals even Noatirtin's vaunted efficacy.
The cat is on <fex>the mat</fex>.
<fex>The cat</fex> is on the mat.
He was against the wall <fex>on Friday</fex>.
<fex>Lights</fex> were on in the primary school
I do n't want to turn round cos the lights are on <fex>at the moment</fex>
Lights were on <fex>on the Kingston road bridge</fex>.
<fex>The night lights</fex> were turned on in the secondary school.
Instantly <fex>Sue</fex> activated the commlink on the wall.
He was in his stocking feet while standing in the bayou that formed when <fex>the wind</fex> turned the shower on in that one upstairs bathroom.
My dad turned the lights on for me <fex>at 10 o'clock</fex>
Suddenly, the lights got turned on <fex>on the Jamaica road bridge</fex>.
<fex>That technology</fex> turned out not to be compatible with the existing devices
My computer is not compatible <fex>with my new printer</fex>.
<fex>Your socks</fex> don't match.
The two applications are compatible <fex>in their essential features</fex>.
<fex>The device</fex> triggered as she walked through the arch.
The alarm went off <fex>at three o'clock today</fex>.
Police came running downstairs when the metal detector went off <fex>at the county courthouse</fex>.
